oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Judge Alfred Thompson Adams, 1980 September 16, excerpt 08
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville lawyer and judge Alfred Thompson Adams, conducted on 16 September 1980 by Leanne Thornton as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Adams, who served Nashville as Chancellor of Part Two of the Davidson County Chancery Court from 1957 to 1970, discusses his family's history with the First Presbyterian Church (later the Downtown Presbyterian Church) and the Second Presbyterian Church. He also discusses the First Presbyterian Church being converted into a hospital by Union forces during the Civil War. The complete interview is available in the repository.
